alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 11 at 1:08PM PDT until April 11 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northeastern San Bernardino County in southern California... Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 200 PM PDT. * At 106 PM PDT, an area of blowing dust was impacting Interstate 15 near the Nevada and California state line including the city of Primm. This dust was resulting in low visibility and increased traffic on the Interstate. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement traffic cameras. IMPACT...Dangerous and sudden reductions in visibility making driving very hazardous. Strong cross winds could also result in blow overs or sudden lane changes for high profile vehicles. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 in California between mile markers 183 and 186. Interstate 15 in Nevada between mile markers 1 and 9. Locations impacted include... Primm. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Las Vegas.
